title: Early Intervention Teaching Methods for Children with Autism: Stimulus Adjustment Strategies Based on Integrated Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic special education theory and understanding of autism spectrum disorder characteristics
context.additional_context: Focuses on helping undergraduate students majoring in speech-language therapy and behavioral intervention acquire efficient intervention techniques in mobile environments.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the three-stage application procedure of stimulus adjustment teaching methods in integrated learning environments
Learners can apply five strategies for adjusting stimulus complexity according to children's performance levels to actual cases
Learners can design methods for linking Nature Environment Tasks (NETs) with digital tasks in smartphone-based microlearning environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
